meanings.definition: Distributing or giving out in small portions.
meanings.sent1: The doling teacher handed out tiny candies to the students.
meanings.sent2: The doling grandmother always gave small gifts to her grandchildren.
meanings.sent3: The doling squirrel shared its nuts with the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The doling raindrops fell gently on the parched earth, quenching its thirst bit by bit.
meanings.sent5: The doling sun peeked through the clouds, warming the chilly morning with its gentle rays.

meanings.definition: To give or distribute in small amounts.
meanings.sent1: She was doling out advice to her friends on how to study effectively.
meanings.sent2: The chef was doling out samples of the new dish to the customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician was doling out tricks to the audience, leaving them amazed.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was doling out praise to the hardworking students, encouraging them to do their best.
meanings.sent5: The charity was doling out food to the hungry families in the community, spreading joy and relief.
